intro: Astragalus rhizanthus, commonly known as the rootless milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and compound leaves. The plant is notable for its unique adaptation to harsh, dry environments, with a deep root system that helps it survive in nutrient-poor soils. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
